jL9BgZU2zODGAMSE55kUSQ.text: came here for lunch with 2 friends, food was absolutely smashing. the flavors, the textures, the colors, just wow. i dont think there are many things you could go wrong eating.... Cancha hmm yummy, ceviche duh, mollejas,aubergine taco's my lord,pulpo chancon wowee. wish there were something like this in toronto, alas london calling.also, service is fantastic, good music, very nice decore inside.

F5KViyoG8Pz_JPTs3ughGA.text: I happened upon Andina accidentally. I was wandering through Shoreditch jet-lagged, forcing myself to adjust to the new time zone. According to the clock, it was brunch time, and I wanted anything that didn't involve sausages and fried eggs. At 11:30, Andina was bustling. Groups of diners were flowing into and out of the restaurant, but luckily there was space at the bar for solo guests. Before I could begin processing what I might want to order from Andina's sprawling menu of Peruvian nibbles, ceviche and street food, I sat down and caffeinated myself. On my way in, I had passed the fresh juice bar, so I ordered the Ekeko, a sweet and unbelievably smooth blend of carrot, melon, pear, maca and ginger. It hit the spot. I followed up with a warm, aromatic quinoa-amaranth porridge topped with fresh berries and served with a side of purple corn syrup. This dish was grittier than traditional porridge, but it tasted luxurious (and filling). It didn't cure my jetlag, but I left Andina feeling well fed and glad that I stopped in.

Mw4EkA06aevtE8k5fjvlFQ.text: Cool place with little Peruvian gems...went here for a late night snack after just having arrived in London. Place has great atmosphere, really friendly staff (even though they totally oversold the amount of food we needed). Would recommend stopping by if you are in the area

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Chicken wings

6dkw7ZPumtHCVuTNs5wGgg.text: Andina is a super cute place took for early breakfast (before it gets crowded) the yogurt & granola is really fresh and has the right amount of sweetness. They have a special weekend brunch menu starting at 8am which includes unique Peruvian dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Sweet potatoe
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Crunchy corn & yogurt&granola

kMDwqOzvoBRMo6Q4hjZnVw.text: Amazingly fresh, generous portions and great staff recommendations. Had a lovely evening, thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

H-dszogGLwBVI_h0xwMibQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants while living in London and had always been meaning to write a review! My friend and I would normally resort to coming here whenever we felt like dining out. This place has great food, service and character!! It's pretty healthy and great for vegetarians given more than 50% of their dishes are vegetarian!! My favorite has been the quinoa burger along with yuca croquetas served over some spicy jam -- the place seems to bring a great balance of taste and healthiness to dining out. I would definitely recommend Andina if you're looking for some tasty and healthy South American food!!

N3erkDxCOp7tilWRfy25Sg.text: I've loved this place for a few years having eaten some of the best food in the world there, but tonight was the first time I took a visiting American, my husband and my 11yo daughter. Our reservation was found immediately (pre-booking is critical) and we were led to a table in the front next to the bar. Although loud, the bar is a fun and lively place to sit and enjoy people watching. We ordered a variety of dishes which included nibbles, 2 ceviches (Andina and Yana), very very strong black olives (you are hereby warned), corn cakes (scrumptious), an eggplant dish, the sublime pork belly and a few other incredible plates. The 11yo ordered a smoothie to drink, which she promptly knocked over. An amazing ballet ensued, where 3 members of staff rushed to our aide. 1 cleaned the table, 1 cleaned the floor, and 1 chased me down as I ran to the ladies to offer handbag cleaning services. Amazing! And to top it off, the same handbag cleaning gent assured my daughter that he had also had a clumsy night with smoothies, resulting in donning his 3rd clean shirt for the evening! He did a wonderful job making her feel better and we were back to normal in no time. Pisco sours are a must and I also had a beautiful glass of wine. For afters, we shared a platter of pumpkin doughnuts with the most delicious port-style dipping sauce, while the daughter had a stunning passion fruit cake. We LOVE LOVE LOVE Andina. You must go there.

uKHKYxmwzs29PpboS5BY2Q.text: Good food. We had 6 small plates and a couple of pisco sours and we paid more than 100 pounds so not the cheapest option. The scallops, octopus and the aubergine are very tasty, and of course you cant miss the ceviche. It is very popular so we had to book an early slot in order to eat there. Great service

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Ceviche
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Conchita

n-EqJmJMe1kDmr-JkgKHEg.text: We dropped in unplanned for a late lunch.Great vibe, nice to sit at counter and watch chefs at work in open kitchen.We both had the Chicharron sandwich - confit of pork belly in a soft bun with a capote ketchup. We started with Taco Taco Quechua - braised aubergine, quinoa,taco taco, quest fresco. Both wonderful.Very friendly Spanish speaking team.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

q8fLPnffmo4ggD2Kb6qe6g.text: Exquisite ceviche, but service was pretty poor. Messed up our order and food took a while to arrive. Very crowded for dinner, reservations recommended.

aChtJCde8yn9a_EyMUoasg.text: Nice food but small portions, so you need to order several plates, and before we realised we ended up paying more than 60 pounds each and not feeling particularly full. It is very popular so you need to book in advanced. For me is not good quality price relation. It was nice to try, but I wouldn't pay the same again.

42y5-DrxMkq9j57sjImOkA.text: Hubs took me here for my birthday since we enjoyed Ceviche in Soho. The atmosphere is fairly similar to Ceviche, but for some reason it feels a little more casual. It is definitely less crowded, too!Though I normally don't drink cocktails, I decided to go for it and try a tamaya pisco. It was quite sweet so not really what I like, but I think if you did like cocktails any pisco from their menu would be great.I ordered the palm hearts salad, grilled octopus, and shared the dulce con cafe (dessert). All were very delicious, but I particularly liked the octopus and the dessert. Hubs got the chicken from the grill and really enjoyed that, which made me guess that most items from the grill selection would be tasty!We were so full we nearly didn't order dessert, but the waiter highly recommended the dulce con cafe so we gave it a try, and we were glad we did! Such a wonderful way to finish off a lovely meal.

tDwPEjGgSfjwotgqb8Yr5A.text: While pricey and hard to snag a reservation, this eatery cannot be missed in Shoreditch.  Easily the best and inventive Peruvian tapas I've ever had.  While you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, the namesake ceviche and croqueta de maca where especially memorable.  The yana ceviche and conchitas are also a must try.  We had the recommended 3 tapas per person and it was more than enough food, although I could have had much more it was so good.  As far as drinks, stick with the pisco sours, they were awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

z-vw8leoizHi5ZLpjtFJ6g.text: Andina was fantastic! We came by for dinner the other night and there were some complications with our reservation, but we got a seat in about 10 minutes. While waiting we ordered some smoothies. Both of the flavors we tried were delicious and gone before we even got a table. As for the food, we ordered about 2 dishes to share among the four of us, which was plenty.  My favorite was the tuna in tigers milk dish, although I loved almost all of them. A few of the dishes were surprisingly spicy, but pleasantly so. For dessert we had the doughnuts, which were perfectly warm and delightful! Our waiter was very energetic and friendly, and our food came extremely quickly. The restaurant was very busy, and a bit loud at times, but we enjoyed the lively music and atmosphere.Would love to come back to Andina!

mq-r22SJkVkD2X_X-K3vNQ.text: Excellent great tastes and super atmosphere.  Staff very friendly and full of good advise.

3iSIJuwc5BIe2nR3xLvNxw.text: I had lunch here on a saturday in december 2014 - it was pretty crowded, but we got seats at the bar. I have never tried peruvian food before, and was slightly baffled by the menu, but the staff are very kind and guided us trough it. We had the quinoa and coriander dumpling, chips with spicy cheese sauce, and corn cake with avocado and poached egg. The food was fresh and well seasoned - the corn cake was particularly good. We also had some delicious freshly squeezed juices.Definitely a good first impression of peruvian cuisine!

eO3IDROrDx9oVeSuYTSukQ.text: I went to Andina on a date, and it was such a treat. The Andina ceviche, flower tempura (different name on menu) and the grilled octopus were delicious. The restaurant serves food that makes you think- the textures are playful and the flavor combinations unexpected. What made this experience 5 stars was our server, Maddalena, who truly made us feel welcome like we were old friends and provided exceptional care throughout the meal.

ysBAbZC-2EmkDFdL6uPOaQ.text: This place was amazing. We waited a bit in the back for our table but the served us drinks and nuts while we waited. We were seated around the kitchen area and it was great to watch them sling together our tapas style orders. The octopus was to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Bar seating at the kitchen. Dinner and show!

foa6SEdv8OocxxHmn3yMtQ.text: As a veggie, sitting next to the kitchen is always a sad revelation that you'd rather be oblivious to.Deep fryer used for veg/chips and meat(or seafood?), as is the grill, used for octopus, meats and veggie burger buns. It angers me, this sort of thing should really be mentioned on menu, seeing as veggie/gluten free stuffs is very clearly labeled. Whilst I'm here, should add that deep frying quinoa for veggie burger, when quinoa is uncooked very much, also tastes rank and bitter.All in all,  not recommended for strict veggies. Nice friendly waiter staff though.

zOKUZkkE8qQeA6H6GS1PmQ.text: The food here is heavenly. I would have never thought that eating gluten free can be delicious. :) If you go here, you will have to get the scallops and Don Ceviche (sweet potato salad - amazing). Best scallops you will find. If you are planning to go for dinner, you will have to book in advance, as pop-ins, especially Fridays or Saturdays, are nearly impossible.

QkF9tBhTS4RmvWtbSOqHBg.text: Had dinner here on "National Pisco Day". My girlfriend is actually Peruvian, and we have been to every Peruvian restaurant in London. However, this is the one that we have come back to and it is because she says its exciting modern takes on Peruvian food but still sticks to the foundations of traditional Peruvian cusine. The Cerviches are the trademark dishes here and there is a great selection of different seafoods to go for which makes it more interesting than the boring standard white fish cerviches you get in other Peruvian places. I think the best dishes here are the Anticuchos and the Chicken skewers. They have been marinated and grilled so well that you can really taste the flavours blend with the soft meat in your mouthAtmosphere is great! Good music (the owner has his own Peruvian record label) and amazing jazzy art on the wallsI have not given this 5 stars as I dont think the drinks are that good and are just gimmicky. They flavour the piscos but its just a different syrup that they add each time. They also did nothing for "National Pisco day" at all!...so they slearly concentrate on their foodAwesome and unique place however!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

HjrqW7IBIGU8JpNRaNVfqg.text: So far, I'm only qualified to review the breakfast, but it was so good, I'm going to go ahead anyway.We have a company team meeting every Thursday morning, and our default venue is always The Breakfast Club by Hoxton Square. I've been trying to get my colleagues to move around a bit more, although other places have been poor in comparison (barring Dishoom, which is excellent). Having tried Andina last week, it is now in my top three, and if it is this consistent on future visits, could even claim #1. Their 'full english' equivalent is some kind of pork belly offering, perfectly fried eggs, grilled tomatoes, lovely thin mushrooms (not the soggy English breakfast style) topped off with a side serving of avocado on sourdough toast. Mmmmmm. Their fresh juice and smoothy selection is also excellent. Just don't make the mistake my colleague made of ordering the quinoa porridge - she ended up being very jealous.So a great breakfast overall.  I plan to go back for lunch or dinner soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

OumfnRL1KO2wIv3IngShzw.text: Preface: I was staying down the street and passed this a few times before venturing in, I don't have any special craving for Peruvian food, and I've been trained not to expect anything gourmet / crafty from it. Not that I have any hatred for it, I just don't seek it out. Anyhoo, credit must be given to the inviting look of the place thru the windows for convincing me to give this place a try. The interior is indeed cozy, clean, modern / rustic (the look of all the new architecture in Shoreditch, but lighter and less assuming), just had a good vibe overall. Staff was friendly and welcoming too.Well I'm so glad I stopped in - not once, but twice. It just became my go-to place when I wanted local lunch.Had the Green bean mixed salad both days. It's hard to find a good salad anywhere, and this one was simple, light and satisfying. When you can integrate radicchio and make it taste great, you get props from me.On one day I had the Quinoa Burger (w/ Kiwi Yogurt and Chili Mayo), and it was fine. It didn't really hold together as a patty, but it all tasted good. They get points for at least attempting a burger made out of Quinoa.The next day I had the Trout skewers in rocoto pepper, which was super-tasty. Fish was cooked perfectly.I really enjoyed the place overall, the finest lunch dining I had in London, and I was in town for two weeks.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Colorfully simple salad
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Trout skewers in rocoto pepper: super-tasty. The greens (whatever they were?) were a pleasant surprise.

VK8gMaqLz42w-UGXc1QYKA.text: Keeping with the theme of world food, right on our door step, I hereby give you the Peruvian Andes. Unless you have visited or ate the cuisine you would never associate such a vibrant, exotic, rich and diverse place with such simplistic nutritious subtle food. Andina in Shoreditch is the second restaurant from Martin Morales, (Ceviche in Soho being the first with a third restaurant opening in Old Street in 2015).  The food is exactly how I like it, to share. It is reminiscent of house dinners with the family. Plates of goodness arriving at the table, arms reaching across to spoon portions, sighs of fulfillment and chatter as a background soundtrack.The food is awesome. We had Mario Florian Tiradito, purple grazetiradito, beef steak, red & white quinoa, avocado and cucumber salad, lamb and many more plates. For 3 of us, we ordered 3 items each which was suggested by the waitress. Good call - as everything is so tasty, you want everything. The food really lights up your taste buds with some dishes working the zest. Service was seamless and in saving the best for the last, their "Macaroni Cheese" (Huancaina Macaroni) is literally food porn. Tasty, filling and dangerously tempting to order a second. When I returned to the office, I wished I was in a country which allowed for a siesta, as I really needed to recover from effects of this food extravaganza. Highly recommended, definitely worth it.

jPltslKYs1Rq_uL7ozPtpw.text: Peru.In 1978 they turned Scotland over properly in the World Cup, and they did it in the most stylish of kits, diagonal sash stripe and all. We should have left it on that high note. But now they're back. And it's their cuisine they are asking us to fall in love with. It seems to be working. Everyone banging on about it. Time to get involved. Andina.In the heart of Shoreditch.Helpful, passionate staff.Comfy surroundings.Everyone raving about the place.Top lunchmates.Ex boss paying.What's not to like?Unfortunately, the food.It's not that it's executed badly. The dishes seemed to be made with love and care and passion.It's just - slightly nervous typing this - I'm not sure Peruvian food is that nice.Ceviche came with good meaty morsels of raw fish which I happily chomped through. But there's enough salt in the dish to make you wonder whether, served in any other guise, we'd spit it out and declare it poisonous.The quinoa dish looked beautiful. Like an amazing multi coloured sand sculpture. It tasted like that too. Pork belly in a bun was clumsy. The pork belly was incinerated. To my mind cuts like pork belly need time and patience. This dish was given neither and the morsels were presented on a needless hamburger bun and some sort of mayo that floated around and nobody ate.The scallops were delicious but there was a load of other stuff on the plate with it which confused matters. This was a general theme. Lots of different things on each plate. None of them particularly enhancing the main event. It looked pretty but it tasted a bit all over the place.Each dish that came out was interesting. But when you're describing something as interesting, bottom line is you're not really loving it.Best dish we had was the prawn and squid bisque. It tasted just like something from a lovely local Basque cafe. And it made me wonder if the truth is I just don't really like Peruvian food. The nicest thing I ate was straight out of the Med.We have a lot to thank Peru for. The Andes. Illicit drugs. Paddington bear. They can be happy with their contribution without foisting their grub on us thanks very much.

IX3ox9z05xMDfaP5pzoPCg.text: - went there for breakfast at a Sunday morning (breakfast even until 4 pm if I remember well)- reservation recommended (very popular); however, if you are lucky there are free seats at the bar/kitchen (which is also very interesting)- offers a big variety of smoothies and fruit drinks- Peruvian breakfast and quinoa porridge were very tastyConclusion: I would definitively come back to enjoy the Peruvian food again! Not only for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

ZJzLUgukAgb-B_BgYO_9Lg.text: Dinner was just not very good. Consistently bland and boring despite ambitious descriptions.Artichoke Tamal was terrible - vinegary, canned-tasting, stringy artichoke in very little masaThe Bistec Escabochado was good - but maybe 3 oz total. It was very mild-flavored beef, with a slightly vinegary salsa that worked, but wasn't exciting.The Cherna, or chili-marinated Stone Bass was also nicely cooked, but I drenched each bite in the sauce to get a hint of heat.We were going to order the Chullo Salad, until we saw it arrive at the seat next to us - it looked like plain wedges of beets and orange. Instead, we got the Causa Huanuco. While it tasted decent, and the dry powdered beets were fun to scrape off the plate, I wondered "Why is it cold? Why are the beets crunchy? Where's the seaweed? What is this other green stuff?" I checked the menu/placemat - it was a flavorless avocado crema.The Jocote, whipped up quickly in a blender, was nicely frothy with egg white, with a light gin flavor. Like the food, it wasn't particularly strong or complex. Unlike the food, it was tasty.£25 each later, we left hungry.

kdvmc3-F-EE8gZ2dobEJIw.text: Arriving to Andina, I stated we had a booking and was moved to a 4 person table only to be told 5 minutes later that they'd thought we were a three and then asked for my reservation and we were moved to another table. We ordered some food, we had to take cutlery from another table as we didn't have it on ours. My husband's huevos picante arrived. It was fine but the sauce was a little bland. 20 minutes later my food had not arrived and neither had my husband's tea. We asked a waiter about the delay and he said he would check although he wasn't particularly apologetic. My husband made an error in asking for my meal that had scrambled eggs which I corrected and said I had poached. Soon after we received tea and sourdough with scrambled eggs so clearly my order hadn't been taken in the first place. I pointed out that the order was wrong and the waitress who I think was the manager offered to take it back but my husband had well finished his food by then and I wanted to leave. She didn't say sorry. After some more slow service we received the bill with a service charge which we asked to be removed which took another 10 - 15 minutes. The restaurant wasn't particularly busy and there were more staff than customers. Finally at that point we had an apology though not from the person who messed up our order. Normally I don't really comment on the service as the food is more important but in this case it made it a very unpleasant experience and actually the food was pretty average and expensive for what it was. Won't be going back.

meLZAqslVVMRNp7biDJwoQ.text: So cocktails are great. My friend and I had a Maracuyá Sour, my other friends had a Rio Manu. Both delicious. We shared about 12 dishes between the four of us. A couple of things on the menu weren't available but the ceviche was amazing (we had classic and yana). Then ordered tacu tacu, fillet steak, prawns and some corn chips. The food was great, it's not the cheapest night out in that area if you're on a budget but it was definitely yummy. Would go back.

Np46u1q2aiI-xCuYJPj2qA.text: Been here now 5x in the past 2 months and I'm not only never disappointed but my Peruvian mother (from Lima) also not only approves but loved this place. I love this. Hands down. Also had the aguadito de marisco and it blew my mind. Very good. Only complaint from my mother was that there was not enough food, but that's what tapas means. So don't mind my mama.

nGmubEjVeU_xYQyrYNF1bw.text: In love with this place. I have come here for brunch, lunch and dinner several times, always with a new friend. And I leave happy every time!   Recently for brunch we tried the Huevos Q'apachana, two poached eggs, spicy potato puree, spinach, chestnut mushrooms, Huancaina sauce. This is the perfect brunch dish. The puree is silky smooth, and the mushrooms are delicious. I am obsessed with Huancaina sauce after my travels in Peru. And Andina has Huancaina sauce in dishes all over the menu...they get it.I tried the Chicharron Sandwich - confit pork belly, soft bun, camote ketchup. Absolute comfort food. The pork belly was so tender, and the camote ketchup delicious.My friend really enjoyed the Picante de Huevos, as recommended by our waiter. This did not disappoint, especially with a tamal!   From the lunch/dinner menu, I cannot recommend the corn cake & avocado enough - I could eat this every day. Once you taste it, you will know why.It is difficult to fault any dish on Andina's menu. Each one has different textures, and loads of flavour.Great cocktails and smoothies. Get a pisco sour! The only negative thing I have to say is that the chefs LOVE to top every dish with a mountain of raw red onion, which I really dislike so have to take off every time. I must try to remember to ask the waiter to exclude the mountain next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Chicarron Sandwich and Chaska Smoothie. Yummm

eY4Pgw_ivCwYlt1QQiov2A.text: Another little corner place I've walked past on a number of occasions and made a mental note to go back to.Today was that day by sheer coincidence, my flatmate invited a trio of us along and only on arrival did the penny drop (and my excitement levels rocket).This is definitely my new go-to brunch venue in Shoreditch. The menu left me in a tizz trying to decide what I wanted, it just all looked, sounded and smelled so good! Open kitchen next to the seating means you can observe the chefs as they put the plates together and is certainly a cause to wet your appetite! Gorgeous brunch grub with a (you guessed it) Peruvian twist - coriander mayonnaise, sautéed mushrooms and spinach with whole roasted garlic, eggs poached to pure perfection! This was also my first try of a Pisqo Sour (Amazing - recently recommened in TimeOut as one of the best places to go for one and I would absolutely second that) and Quinoa milk latte (They don't serve soya so this was the alternative - Double amazing). Flavoursome and beautifully presented (it took all my willpower not to pocket the kitsch earthenware cup my espresso was delivered in) - I highly recommend a taste! Cosy, warm environment, friendly prompt staff - the perfect venue to fuel up for the day with friends before a trip around Spitalfields or a day of photography around the well graffitied streets of Shoreditch.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

_1taB1qiDD6_DRqA7863AQ.text: The food was decent but the service and environment was stressful! The waiter forced us to order an extra tapas dish. I ordered fried plantains and shrimp but had to order a third dish so I ordered the chips. My friend ordered pork belly and plaintains. As suspected, I was full after the two dishes and felt stuffed with a bit of the chips. They also rushed us out of the restaurant. Overall, I wouldn't come back due to the stressful service.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

21zHRDJ14NwUMSkQrfjDbQ.text: This place has been on my brunch hitlist for a while now, and after last weekend I can happily nail my colours to the Andina fan bandwagon! I'd booked ahead on a Saturday at midday and it was a good job I did, as both the ground level and brightly lit lower level were heaving with hungry hipsters.We were seated downstairs by the friendly front of house, and our waiter immediately struck up some friendly banter which happily continued through the meal without feeling forced. He was particularly amused (as was I) with how quickly we both dysoned our food - it arrived at superspeed so we'd only been there about half an hour and already finished eating!Food envy struck at the Full Peruvian breakfast my mate devoured, though my tastebuds were firing in all the right places with the poached egg and corn cake, served with avo, onion and some lovely spicy salsa and huancaina sauce. Mmm a really great blend of flavours altogether and over far too soon - I could have had another right after it.Luckily they weren't in a hurry to get rid of us, so we happily lingered to enjoy the lively music and some fresh juices (I had the ekeko mix of carrot, melon, maca and ginger and felt great!) followed by coffees. I'm not sure if it all stemmed from the friendly service but there is a real warm, happy feel to the place. The only reason it loses a star is being quite pricey for what it is, but much like others in the ever-popular Shoreditch brunch line-up, it frankly doesn't need to give a damn. It might be a good thing actually, else I'd be here for brekkie every day!Bonus toilet tip: yep the sink area is unisex, but the individual cubicles do have Ms and Fs on, which not everyone seemed to have spotted...

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. corn cake & avocado eggs - i should've ordered two...

Rxq7VbHukqA04V_cQv843g.text: Finally made it to Andina! I took my lovely mum here after a harried redeye arrival from Heathrow (is there any other form?) and it really hit the spot for a leisurely cafe breakfast. After several cups of their own special Peruvian blend coffee (JOLT!), a bowl of quinoa porridge with fresh fruit syrups/summer fruits, and some sourdough toast with avocado and scrambled eggs we were fighting fit to take on the day. Quite delightful, actually. The service was great on a morning midweek. They have a lot more seating downstairs so if the top looks jammed, don't fret...do see the host. They also do a lot of things to takeaway including fresh squeezed juices. See the bar and get yours to go if in a rush. Andina -- now added to my Shoreditch breakfast options! Peruvian-style.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Great communal private dining room seats 20
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Booster seats upon request - kid friendly!

mkTbfVPlTlXI36cY8Sw_Vw.text: Amazing brunch and coffee! Went for the Peruanazo, which included a very interesting rice pancake (tacu tacu) and perfectly cooked eggs and thick chunks of bacon. The onion was a bit pointless although for others this will add to the experience of the dish. Wife had scram and avocado on toast which was beautiful and seasoned to perfection. The waitress was lovely and the service great. Would love to try the main courses and pisco sours on another occasion. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Amazing Peruvian brunch - even more of an excuse to go to Peru...

xY_XaOK27VToRlYFhUW3rg.text: I've been to Andina a couple of times, for both breakfast and to pop in quick for dessert/a drink. My first brunch was good (and I thought a better dining experience than their sister restaurant Ceviche in Soho) but this past visit and dessert was truly delicious. For a drink, my girlfriend and I decided to go non alcoholic and both had Fuerza a mix of quinoa, apple, cinnamon, milk, maca. The server warned us ahead of time that the drink is quite thick and can be a 'meal' in and of itself. It was really delicious (if you dont' like your drinks too sweet) and part of me wanted to grab the recipe to have something healthy to warm up next to a fire with!  For dessert, the Picarones Doughnuts which came with icecream and two dips. I can't recommend this highly enough - if you like melt in your mouth donuts - this is the place to go and the meal to try. I keep dreaming about these and can't wait to bring friends in town visiting when I show them around Shoreditch.The only con both times has been the service - both times i've been here I've found the hostess' to be quite abrupt - I'm sure it is difficult to figure out seating (especially for walk-ins) but both times I haven't felt quite welcomed upon arrival. That being said, once seated the servers have always been very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

sdeIceDxe6iqoKEXvR03vg.text: Food is good, but small portions and expensive. Service is extremely slow everything you need to ask at least 3 times!

XLOq0slKZgAgdc7RKxvvQw.text: All I can say I am craving a trip back to London for this place! Excellent Peruvian good -- creative, well thought of, HEALTHY and most importantly, SO SO SO GOOD.All these superfoods we know of have taken a new identity and have become cooler and tastier than ever. The ceviche selection was five stars, the corn bread was AMAZING, as all our orders were!! We were able to try one of their limited desserts - a deeply satisfying bowl of legit dulce de leche with other yummy things added to it. MY GOD DID I FINISH THAT BOWL AND GOT SO SUGAR HIGH!! WORTH IT.Anyway, bottomline: I LOVE THIS PLACE.

YGiQ4yU-zO4Th57gFMchrg.text: I went here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant is located in the heart of Shoreditch. The decor outside and inside the place are very nicely decorated. Everything is based on a Peruvian theme, and it's got a very happy and festive vibe which I love!I ordered the Huevos Q'apachana. It comes with two poached eggs on top of a bed of delicious potato purée, with spinach and mushrooms. The portion is not big, but it was enough for me. I also had a Fuerza, which is a hot drink with quinoa, cinnamon, apple, milk, and maca. It's a great drink for a cold day, but it was a bit too sweet for my liking. The staff are very friendly, and the service was quite speedy. I would highly recommend Andina to anyone looking for a weekend brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Fuerza - hot drink with quinoa, apple, cinnamon, milk, and maca!
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Huevos Q'apachana, that potato puree is to die for!

dVJ0-Ql8VC5n_k_3SbrSsQ.text: This place is an awesome Peruvian restaurant located not far from Shoreditch High Street station. A group of 3 of us went on a Wednesday evening at 8pm and had to wait 30 minutes for a seat at the shared tables so it gets quite busy - advise booking!The place is pretty big, although it doesn't seem it when you first walk in. There are 10 or so small tables for 2-4, a small bar and a restaurant are where I think they finish prep. Around the back on the same floor is a room with 2 large tables which are the shared tables although would also be perfect for large groups. This space is nice and light as it has a glass roof. On the floor below is plenty more seating for small to medium size groups. In all plenty of seating and I was very surprised at how long we had to wait to be seated - it must be popular!We waited at the small bar and ordered a cocktail each (all pisco based) - I can highly recommend the cucumber and apple cocktail; very refreshing!When we were sat at the shared table we were round a corner so we were able to talk quite easily and also as we were sharing everything it was easier to share than in a line of 3! We had had ages to look and the menu and decided on the quinoa croquetas, duck ceviche, chicken casserole, cassava chips, slow cooked ox tongue and sweet potato salad. Everything comes out as ready so we have 2 plates, then a further 3. Unfortunately our salad didn't come before we had finished everything else so we cancelled as we didn't fancy it on it's own. Everything was good but some things were FANTASTIC (ox tongue, duck and cassave chips). The other things I probably wouldn't order again.Cannot wait to come back as there was plenty on the menu I wanted to try (especially as I wasn't sure I would enjoy the ceviche). Pudding menu also looked fab but we weren't hungry enough. Looks good for brunch/ breakfast as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

9QmqNKnTRKn05yTW3gsStg.text: very nice staff!! Awesome food, small plates so you can try everything! Try the pisco it is reqlly good and it really matches with the food!

I_sjF09Swm7r2NHnytvrog.text: Great food and brilliant drinks.I cannot sing the praises of Andina enough. They peruvian food is delicate and flavorsome.The staff are attentive, bringing us a range of small plates at precisely the right times. This nibbling style of eating is delightful, each dish providing a new delight to the eyes as well as the taste buds.The cuisine provided here is fun and intriguing, their aren't many peruvian places around and certainly not so well executed.From the people who brought us Ceviche this restuarant has a similar vibe, not so loud and noisey but still buzzing with conversation. A GREAT place for a date.  Ceviche is indeed on the menu but this is only part of the offering.I'd highly reccomend it.On a side note they have a whole Vegan menu, my date was eating only vegan food and could not rave enough about how delicious it was. So a truly great option for those with specific dietary requirements.

iWspYxjF3tonIr7H_uG84Q.text: Apparently Peruvian restaurants are the latest craze and I can't wait to come back for a proper meal - actually coming here for a birthday dinner on Friday, so won't have to wait long.Today I settled for a freshly squeezed fruit juice - just couldn't resist the temptation when I spotted the bar section next to the main restaurant.  The juice was lovely and fresh but tasted mainly of orange juice, none of the more exotic ingredients.OK, that was then and this is now.  I tried cerviche a couple of times before but didn't think much of it ...  several variations of this raw fish delicacy featured on the set menu  (£30 pp) we mmm'd and aaah'd our way through on Friday.  It is difficult to agree on a favourite when every single dish is yet another taste sensation.  The chicken and lamb skewers were almost boring as they resembled food we recognised - mind you, like everything else they came with the most interesting sauces and were just simply delicious, anything but regular!The food alone deserves more than five stars.  Unfortunately, the experience was spoilt by the sheer speed at which the dishes were delivered to our table.  Food this good really shouldn't be rushed!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

bXFi96N-B2kMOv4CP1Ms4A.text: Delicious food and good service. I really enjoyed the corn cake and choclo burger. The smoothies and cocktails were good, too. Next time I'm in London, I'm coming back to Andina.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

P_-DxC7xRm3qit33emS0Jw.text: We found this place because we were staying at the Ace hotel just a block away. We've been to Peru and love the food. We tried several of the ceviches and they were amazing and each quite distinct. The hot dishes included beef, lamb and grilled octopus. We enjoyed them all. The food was at the same time authentic to that we had in Peru and yet better than we had in our travels there. Great Peruvian drinks based on Pisco as well.

I_qAXv0cJEfPvXYjzgB-9A.text: On the recommendation of a friend, we stopped by here for dinner on the way back from Greenwich. The staff was friendly, service was fast, the food was a delicious change from the South American dishes that we've seen elsewhere, and the prices are reasonable. A good value for tasty food and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Ceviche Andino - a plate of ceviche awesomeness, but best paired with something to balance the tartness.
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Pato Santiago - this delicious bit of duck just fell off the bone.

J0QOCSt81Py7TDO_tOM16w.text: Fantastic flavours but service really struggles here when it's busy as we experienced a few Sundays ago for brunch. It took a server a while to come to our table and even then basic requests such as tap water kept having to get repeated. Anyway onto the food: I got the braised aubergine, quinoa tacu tacu patty and crumbled feta to start. Simply phenomenal textures and flavour combinations, with a mole-like sauce on the aubergine and the slight crunch of the patty blending well. The feta really was the icing on the cake. I also ordered the corn tamal, kale pesto and cancha corn but the waiter got the wrong order and brought me the pork tamale instead. Anyway this was soon rectified by another waitress (who couldn't seem to distinguish between veg and vegan but no matter!) and my meal arrived readily. Again it was a phenomenal mix of flavours! My companions got the black rice and mango salad and that earned my high praise. My husband got the avocado pancakes and I even raved about them: they were sweet and fluffy and tasted nothing like avo. It's not the cheapest brunch but not the most expensive. I would return here just know you're not going to get the best service.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Corn tamal, kale pesto
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Braised aubergine
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

lzJPPz6cXyELZpHEGVPwUQ.text: the food was AMAZING. It was my first time in a peruvian and I would 300% come back to this place. The service was brilliant, if it hadn't been for Giorgia I wouldnt have ordered the dishes I did, and they left me with no words! If you have a chance do not hesitate to go.

Ib7MY5wQUIBHIKYYnuq9Nw.text: This food is sneak-attack spicy... even the dishes which didn't sound like they would be hot were inedible by my palette. My spice-loving boyfriend could handle the heat, but he can also survive eating a ghost pepper. While there are plenty of veg options and the dishes looked pretty, even the chips had a spicy sauce so I basically watched my boyfriend eat then went home and made dinner for myself. Also, the surrounding tables were seated after us and were finished eating by time we started to receive our food, so all in all, a very "meh" experience.

MzmQ9jYcJlky4ZAvRFTiIg.text: As others have noted, this restaurants proximity to the Ace Hotel makes it an attractive destination for visitors to London. I highly recommend starting off with a cocktail, and the one to get is the Pisco sour. The other highlight of the evening was the grilled octopus which is one of the best dishes I've had as of late.The other items we ordered were the steak, the sea bass ceviche, and the chullo salad. I would pass on the steak next time, but the ceviche was quite good. Excellent, friendly service made this a place to come back to next time we're in town.

fHrJg6SV2LcUoCJniGEWQA.text: I've been excited to come here because of all the great reviews! We finally made the trip and were surprisingly seated right away. There are two floors, a very relaxing yet romantic atmosphere, and dim lighting with a rustic vibe. Service started off average then turned out to be awful. My niece asked the waitress to take back the shrimp because she tasted it  and found it tasteless and hard to eat. You literally get little pieces of the shell left over in your mouth which is why I said it's hard to eat. The waitress asked if she liked it to which my niece replied "no" but wasn't offered anything to replace it. We just found that weird because if you know your customer is unhappy with what they received, typically the waiter is supposed to ask them if they would like to order anything else.To drink I got an Americano coffee which was your average American cup of coffee. But anyways, to eat I also got the shrimp which I also found tasteless but as I was starving I ate them anyway. I also got the torrejas de plátano which was so good! Whatever the cream stuff was it came with was super satisfying and really complimented the plátano. The last thing I got was the tacu tacu which is basically braised eggplant but OMG it was the best eggplant I've ever tasted! My niece also got this and she's not a fan of eggplant but found this dish very delicious. Lastly, my niece got the chips (fries) with huancaina sauce which was nothing special, just average. For dessert we got the doughnuts which were god awful! A manager came by and asked if everything was ok and my niece asked if there was supposed to be a filling inside which he replied "no" to. She asked this because the doughnuts were definitely undercooked. There was clearly raw batter inside so the manager apologized and took it away. Apart from the manager coming around from table to table to ask how everything was going, the waitress never asked how we were doing or if I wanted another coffee. Our major problem here was that my niece ate two pieces of shrimp yet was charged for it and when she asked the waitress about this she's like how it was halfway eaten which it wasn't. However, the doughnuts we ordered (which were actually halfway eaten) we weren't charged for so I don't really understand her logic. We didn't want to argue she argued to pay for this. When the bill finally came the shrimp was off of it, so, again, I don't understand why they were going to make her pay if the second time around the shrimp wasn't on the bill.I also don't see the point in the waitress asking if she liked the shrimp if she wasn't going to do anything about it -- makes no sense! Also, as a manager, when there's a customer complaint they typically come back around more than once but after that initial visit, he didn't check on us nor did he seem to care that our experience wasn't a good one. I'm really not a complainer but coming as a visitor from one developed country to another, you expect a certain level of service which definitely was not fulfilled at Aldina. We travelled 30 minutes by bus in the pouring rain to get here because of all the great reviews but unfortunately we didn't have the same positive experience the majority has seemed to have had here. I typically never rate this low but after the treatment we received, I couldn't give a good rating, regardless of the fact overallI enjoyed my food. I just wish that establishments could understand that service is just as important as the food being served and can make or break a situation. There are times I can recall where I've been to a restaurant where I didn't necessarily enjoy the food but gave a good rating because of the amazing service and actually went back to try something different on the menu. This goes to show that as a consumer we don't just pay for food but service as well. Time to step it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Doughnuts
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Platano
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Tacu tacu

Kr_Z5artTynVZNLUb4sViw.text: Went here for brunch on a weekend. Do make a reservation as they get quite busy. Ordered the sweet potato pancakes and the huevos Q'apachana. Both the dishes were delicious! Couldn't leave without trying the popular pisco sour - lived up to its expectation! Could down half a dozen of those! Too bad it was only noon, too early to be drinking? ;-)

yr34I3nk12w3XZ5Js5-quQ.text: They have lovely food here. I was a big fan of the ceviche and the scallops. Very yummy. I'm also a fan of how beautiful it is- they do a wonderful job of presenting the food. I'd say it wasn't tooooo classy that they let us wait around for a while before taking our order and then reminding us that we needed to leave within 2 hours a few times... but hey, the food was lovely and beautiful, and we had a nice time. Their drinks are great too! I'd come again and just make sure to yell when I want to order. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Scallops
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Tuna ceviche
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine- delish

pRPmmVytPAIgBXBcqLt0Vw.text: Such a good twist on the taps that you're used to. The ceviche is amazing, and everything else has really intricate flavors. Make sure you reserve a table, it's a pain to get a table. Also, watch out when sharing - somedishes are impossible to share with more than two people. Also, if you are really hungry, be prepared to quickly spend at least 30£ a person (hence only 4 stars) :)

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

09hCLzWMyJ2zL7MfM1AS6Q.text: Lovely Peruvian spot; great for sharing. Outstanding bar; fabulously creative and fresh cocktails. The fish broth fish was delightful; although not sure how Peruvian it was, and high marks for the artichoke ceviche (doesn't have fish; just a delightful aji Amarillo sauce!). Reservations recommended as this is a little spot and fills up quickly; sit at the chef's table so you can see the magic in action.

BDo0HF3NwxB4DtuJYPeDtQ.text: Noticing this is a 4 star rated restaurant and reading great reviews from Yelpers whom I have great respect for, I was very disappointed with my experience.My dining partner had booked a table for the two of us.  When I arrived, given it was a Thursday night, this was a wise move as the place was packed.  A little too snug on the table spacing but for hip trendy Shoreditch, I don't think many mind.The dish I wanted was not available so opted for the pan fried secreto iberico and whilst this was to be found under the 'Street Food' section of the menu, it was reasonably priced at  £13 so expected, if not a larger serving of the meat then at least reasonable additional food items on the plate.  It was essentially a small cut of pork with a smear of cauliflower puree.  The pork was average, some chewing required but the plate was scrapped clean just because of hunger.   I feel the waitress could have provided some insight into the portion sizes and maybe recommendations of e.g. people tend to order X plates, etc. With wine and much catch up talk, we were informed it was nearly 9pm (we didn't ask for the time) and that the next booking would be arriving soon.  We were not told that there was a turnaround time on the tables.  This is something I actively avoid in restaurants as their goal is clearly about how many people can be served rather than the experience and maybe repeat custom.With that, no dessert was ordered and we left with me being pretty hungry given the portion size.  We departed having paid our £60 bill (1 bottle of wine 2 'mains' and a shared starter) very disappointed and not intending to return.

pB3OhkngY8QgnftabXo6lg.text: You know a place is worth a review and raving review when you come back for breakfast two days in a row. I've had Peruvian food, but nothing quite like Andinas'. Unfortunately, I am only able to review on the breakfast as I didn't have enough time to eat lunch, dinner or their weekend brunch menu (my only complaint is that I wish they provided this menu all days of the week-sad I only stumbled on this on weekday and left before weekend). For beverages:-Fuerza: a must order hot drink!! Made with quinoa, Apple, cinnamon, milk and moca, this milky creamy latte consistency  of a drink gave me the feels.-Hot Emoliente: another must order hot drink. If you're not feeling anything milky, I suggest ordering this. Barley, linseed, alfalfa and quince. Can't get anymore healthy than this. Weekday breakfast items:-pudding de Maiz (corn soufflé with slice of bacon, smeared avocado purée with the perfect poached egg)-sweet potato pancakes: I mean ,come on!! So good-chia seed pudding. Holy moly. Will blow your mind away With a cookbook of their own, you know that Andina doesn't mess around. Get your tushy over here NOW.

CNRDDlGclsqbVfg3zTE_pQ.text: Wow, where do I start. First of all, I didn't make reservations. It was my birthday, and the first restaurant my friend, grandmother and I visited had a 1.5 hr wait, so after some searching, we stumbled on Andina. The hostess and manager worked with us and we were able to get a table. My waiter was really friendly, and when another waiter found out that it was my birthday, he really went above and beyond. He got me a spicy drink on the house, and had the entire restaurant sing happy birthday to me! Certainly as night to remember

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

Yj6jdQ_n66tmVoT1X_yIRw.text: Good old-fashioned Peruvian food with a modern, and dare I say, deliciously-healthy twist. The prices may be a little steep for some people looking for a simple breakfast or brunch, but the quality is worth it, and really, check out the area this place is in. It's like the up-and-coming Arts District of London. It is usually packed, but if there aren't too many in your group, you may be able to snag a table downstairs. Now, down to the food. Their brunch items are super popular here, and with good reason. The fare is heavy in South American favorites like purple corn, quinoa, sweet potato, exotic fruits, cassava, and other such healthy-for-you starchy goodness. Their Sweet Potato Pancakes with Spiced Chancaca Honey, Coconut Whipped Cream, Seasonal Fruit, and Dried Physalis is a decadent way to start your day while still feeling like you're doing something good for your body. Sort of.The rest of their menu items vary from the sweet to the savory, light to the hearty, and everything in between. They also make superfood smoothies and juices in house, and while not cheap, you may be able to use one as a quick meal replacement that may keep you satiated for a few hours. And if you love starting your day with booze, they offer some high-quality options of that, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Sweet Potato Pancakes
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. They also have a juice and coffee bar area.
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. It does get packed here.

B2KeyfEa4E9lFcA2ZmSurw.text: Wow, this was easily my second favorite London dining experience, then we went back for breakfast, and that was easily the best breakfast we had our entire time in London.

BS2H4eF8G8YiNHaW-p3WdA.text: Really good food. Was recommended by a colleague, her suggestion of going to Andina's did not disappoint. Food was great, pisco sours were alcoholic, atmosphere loud and service decent. I actually took someone here, thought I'd impress them, granted it was an expensive night, but food was worth it. Funny story, I asked for the bill, went to the loo and when I got back my date had paid for the whole thing!?!? Felt like I owed her one, sure I've paid it all back by now with food and wine. Anyway...I've just gone on and written a mini story/essay.8/10 for ceviche. There are two other places for ceviche nearby (kinda), one called 'ceviche' in old st and another in Kingly Court (can't remember the name of this place, also not actually that close). Andina beats them on the quality of food imho, but can seem a bit pricy.

wIUEzTubOzKGlp0Zwj2DJw.text: Small-plate Peruvian dishes that make for a fantastic opportunity to share a meal with a large group. The food was delicious- no plates disappointed. We tried pretty much everything labeled gluten free on the menu and it was all Celiac-friendly.

l3zs7jOJXuAtFCOj-DI6sg.text: SO.. I had never tried Peruvian food and my boyfriend's Christmas present was to take me to Andina's for dinner. The service is nice, very quick and I am in love with Peruvian cuisine. All the dishes are tapas style and for sharing. They only do Peruvian drinks and we LOVED Piso sour! The octopus was finger licking good, we had a cold fish starter that I can't remember the name of - OMG, so flavoursome! They also have corn for nibbles- popcorn but not popped and yum! Also, ask for fried prawns!Only slightly bit expensive so I'd recommend it for a special occasion!! :)

lWUe9BkDihL5SU8HRYpNNQ.text: Do NOT go for the menu option. You'll have to share everything and figure out how to handle that. We've got into the awkward situation of sharing 3 duck legs among 7 people. Apparently 1 plate serves 2 people. Unless you are an odd number, because in that case they'll round down to the lowest integer. So you'll get 3 plates for 7 people. For the dessert, we had the luxury of sharing 5 plates. I gave 2 stars because the food was actually good, despite the stinginess. For 30£ + drinks I would not expect to be fighting over food.

vlbv3D2KI-vhrtpKq1qlDQ.text: Restaurant with ingredients of top quality and great preparations. Service is very careful and friendly as well. It is pretty pricey but it is something you should expect given that there aren't many Peruvian restaurants around.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

CojBwbSWq0eq9xQ-NbJFLw.text: Had a great night at andina.. Loved the shares starters (especially the prawn soup/stew)... The steak for main was really tender, but lamb trumped it.. The pisco was a little too sour but otherwise will be back. Worth a look..

y_jZww3JOo8m-XGG8Fi-NQ.text: *Brunch Review*I definitely couldn't fail to be excited by the prospect of a Peruvian breakfast.  Andina is part of the Ceviche stable (founded by Martin Morales), so I expected some pretty good things.  As Katie B mentions, we got a spot overlooking the kitchen without a booking at 12:30 on a Sunday.  Just my sort of spot, especially seeing as we got to watch pork being deep fried, batch after batch.  The staff were pretty friendly towards us (unlike some of the other reviewers' experiences) which is also a plus.Starting off, we ordered a Chambi juice (cucumber, grapefruit, pear, and ginger) and coffees.  The juice wasn't sweet at all, but very refreshing - some may find it a bit bitter, but I liked it.  It was garnished with some gooood slices of pear too.  The coffee (Italian style) is not bad either.For dishes, we ordered a Cheeky Ceviche, some cassava fries (which never materialised - probably a good thing as I did end up pretty full without), an omelet de Conchas, and a full Peruvian.  The ceviche was excellent.  the fish cheek gives the dish a much different texture than I've come to expect...I think they're also slightly stronger tasting as well.  The blood orange went really well with it too.  I expected great ceviche and we got it.The rest of the mains...aiya.  Katie has summed up hers pretty well.  My Full Peruvian...full marks for the deep fried pork chicharrons (jn a tasty tomatoey type sauce) which were excellent.  The avocado on toast was also pretty good.  Everything else was, well, quite frankly insipid which was highly disappointing.  The eggs/tomato/mushroom were pretty standard.  The potato rosti wasn't good at all.  I spent a lot of time as an Undergraduate making potato rostis, and this paled in comparison...the inside seemed undercooked, the outside wasn't crispy, and it had a kind of frozen potato taste (don't get me wrong, I love my potato waffles, but this wasn't very pleasant).  Generally, I love the twisted Full Englishes I've tried at various brunch places - Franze and Evans' Italian-style one, or Koya's Full English Udon.  In that regard, this one was utterly disappointing.  Except for the pork,  Give me the pork any day.I really want to like Andina, and I will probably give it a second chance at some point.  Still, at this point, it's difficult to justify brunching there considering that the excellent Franze & Evans and Dishoom are in the immediate vicinity.  Unless I'm in a particularly fishy mood, it won't take me much to overlook this one.  I had a similar feeling after eating at Ceviche (although the quality of the mains there was way better than those here) - excellent ceviche, but just not enough outside of that, and a hint of style over substance.  Still, there's potential here if they do take things on board.

pnJHwU05YECRHzhgcyPTPg.text: Went with my wife on a Saturday evening. We ordered 3 types of ceviche, which were good but not the best we've had, the monkfish, which was very good, and the casaba chips, which was amazing.  The service was kind but extremely disorganised (warm beer, no water, had to chase the server a few times). Overall I don't regret coming but don't think I'll come back.

6ouf6UHYd2KsHGjBXC7K3g.text: This sister-restaurant of Ceviche (Soho) doesn't disappoint!We were especially impressed with their diversified brunch/lunch menu offerings, and their fresh juices are so refreshing! They explain all their exotic Peruvian ingredients and their health benefits in a little A-Z booklet accompanying the menu. Great service! My only caveat would be that it's slightly pricey for the smaller portions, but worth it!

Ydod61y7dlbt1TQIwpA5ZA.text: As a recent transplant to London from NYC, I couldn't be happier to be in Shoreditch with the cool kids.  When Andina opened I was excited to have a new fun place right around the corner--but when I finally ate there I nearly lost my mind!!!  Had I forgotten how good food could be??? After a streak of lack-luster meals in the area where you walk out feeling "did I really just pay THAT for THAT????" Andina was mind-blowingly, tear-jerkingly, butterflies in your stomach good!

msacoPSTQj59xb5tjsSQag.text: Good food but prepare to have your lunch/breakfast served in an hour. Waited 25  minutes for the food to get prepared. Cook forgot to place the order. Unless you have tons of times to spare prepare sit forever! Avoid it at all times

FhT4vVZey69CDYsb2gjkEw.text: Great breakfast, the quinoa porridge with fruits was amazing as we're the eggs with avo and sourdough. Coffee was also very good and was happy to hear it was their own blend.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. 2 eggs, avo and sourdough
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom

1hrQCyt4zwL1Ai8DDLtmxg.text: Great place for vegans & non-vegans. Came for Saturday brunch at 10:30, six people, no booking because we were early, but were immediately sat upstairs. Menu was a little hard to understand if you don't know Peruvian cuisine, but the server helped us. There is a dedicated vegan menu. Great, fresh, flavorful dishes with tomatoes, avocado, and a rice-and-bean cake. One of us has a quinoa allergy, and there was still plenty of choice while avoiding it. Gluten-free and Meat-eaters with us enjoyed their egg things and pork belly sandwich thing.

EvUnPoJX1qoHdf89kMf37w.text: You know a meal is good when you're still thinking about it the following day, as I am about last night's meal at Andina - what might be described as an upmarket Wahaccas. The atmosphere is friendly and the main downstairs dining area was well lit with good Latin music playing. Our waiter was extremely helpful and recommended several dishes to us Peruvian foodie first timers, even bringing us a shot of one of the marinades to try out. We were advised to have between 3 and 4 dishes to share (go for 4 as the portions are not huge) and were left feeling perfectly full.The sea bass ceviche was absolutely delicious and beautifully flavoured with watermelon, strawberries, and a very spicy 'tiger milk' sauce. The chicken and avocado cacos was quite small and with a delicate flavour easily drowned out by the other dishes but thankfully it came first and we were able to enjoy it, along with some really great, if slightly bland, lamb skewers. They also make excellent chips which were perfect for soaking up the tiger milk. All the food was between about £6 and £10 per dish which for portion size is sometimes a little steep. However tapas-style dining is always enjoyable and all in all the experience was delicious and I will certainly be going back to explore more Peruvian cuisine!

4usrbI3MkZzNAfZhaUoraw.text: The ceviche was perfect... salmon & octopus from the grill were fabulous. Loche is a beasty side. BOOK if you're going for dinner. Enjoy!

HzbbFftIXJUVBP2JzHVeGg.text: We love the Peruvian kitchen already but Andina really delivers on expectations. The  ceviches are inspirational, fresh and super well done. The crispy corn is one of the best snacks I've ever tasted. Amazing corn cake. And if you like donuts, try to stay away from that boat formed shared desert. Pumpkin donuts served with syrup and chocolate on the side (to dip in). And then the Pesco sour, perfect either as an aperitif or to the food. Already came back three days after the first visit...

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. These donuts, you'll need a marathon to recover..

ejSZDxcVhKavMQn8P9ypRQ.text: Excellent Peruvian small plates. Sat at the bar downstairs as a solo diner and enjoyed talking to one of the chefs. Had the ceviche Andina (sea bass) and the Pulpo (grilled octopus) followed by the mango dessert. All were excellent. Menu is great and healthy- or indulgent, if you wish! Highly recommend.

vt0teq96Gm5Zpf4lk8HuOA.text: Had a fantastic time here on Friday. Our party of 4 had 3 or 4 dishes each and I think the only thing we didn't like too much was the vegetarian burger. The chicken casserole and corn /avocado cakes were especially delicious. The bill for the food plus 6 beers and 2 cocktails came to around £150 which I thought was pretty reasonable.

x1sSRRM-d2GeqMT50d41zw.text: So disappointing. I went for an evening meal  here - the waitress recommended 3 dishes each as it was a tapas-style menu... and the bill was a whopping £55. Not only were the dishes bland and overpriced, the staff kept interrupting our meal.Pricing was inconsistent along with portion sizes... One to avoid!

T7ivJFIhqikX0ahm9n6k5Q.text: Very inventive dishes with a Peruvian twist. I've been there now twice. Once for brunch and another time lunch. Excellent service to go with the excellent food.  Highly recommended.

vFIsJwxIU7mmkjm8oFai5Q.text: I absolutely LOVED Andina. Came here with my dad, we were staying at an Airbnb in shoreditch and our host recommended this place.We arrived around 9pm on a Friday night. There were no available tables, but the hostess actually called people who had reservations to see if there were any cancellations, and one person cancelled, so she sat us right away!We ordered 6 dishes to share between the two of us, as our server recommended. Everything we had was absolutely amazing. The classic ceviche was incredibly tasty and fresh. We ordered the salmon and lamb chop for our main two dishes, both were flavorful, well cooked and presented beautifully. We also had a wonderful Spanish wine recommended to us by our server.The service, food and ambiance all exceeded my expectations. The food is a bit pricy, I think our bill came out to around 70 pounds for the 2 of us, but well worth it for a special occasion or nice date out. Would highly recommend.

zkSljrDdD4-LnCcTS0C4UQ.text: Managed to get a walk in table for two early evening. Although we were sat downstairs (upstairs in nicer) we were quite happy to get a table as it was busy. Lovely decor and feel to the place and very attentive service. Our waiter talked us through the menu (we found it quite amusing as he recommended everything) and insisted we ordered a pisco sour to start with. So we did! We ordered five dishes (six we advised) including the must have ceviche Andina, a baked chicken casserole and some quinoa salads and sides. All were delicious, well flavoured and really enjoyable. Paid £52 for five dishes and two drinks which we were quite happy paying as we felt it was worth it. Unusual and tasty Peruvian cuisine, excellent service and a great setting. Would like to go for brunch next time as it's supposed to be good.

ie02LPu43sj-3zcW5XxY2A.text: Sister restaurant to Ceviche and is equally wonderful.  More meat based than Ceviche and every dish we ordered was cooked perfectly with an amazing taste.  The chunky chips are a must if you go.

3Kq2UTewlU9fbmXh5ZirbA.text: Great food and great service! Would recommend Andina to anyone in the area. Break for brunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Eggs and corn bread

vfLJqOPlErLX5X94Qzx1xA.text: Great vibe in the restaurant and yummy spicy food! The sauces were really yummy and I was tempted enough to buy their book. Excellent eggs if you're looking for a brunch spot.

OOdQsNMqaV9W_CXArYfe7g.text: No complaints. I had a peruvian breakfast, which is a lot like a british one. We were sat in the basement which was very well done and didn't feel dungeon-y at all. It was OK, but I wouldn't go back.

I6JN48sIXVIu0nOr3wZLNA.text: Amazing ceviche and pisco! Would definitely comeback, the portion sizes aren't massive but definitely makes up for it with being super tasty!

-k5iye3y7GtykxMx5BhRPg.text: A Peruvian restaurant that just opened in Shoreditch. I went there for Sunday brunch once and it is instantly my favorite restaurant. It is not a big restaurant and looks quite unassuming from the outside. I wasn't sure what to expect, I decided to go for brunch as a low risk first try. The brunch menu was very creative and everything sounded very appetizing. My friend and I settled on one sweet and one savory dish: Omelet with scallop and wild mushroom and corn cake. The corn cake was made from corn and gueso fresco, creamy with natural sweetness from the corn. I loved it. As we were eating we had serious food envy, so we ordered a ceviche to try. The waiter recommended the seabass ceviche which was another highlight of the meal. I would have ordered a different type of ceviche if I were not about to burst. I am so thrilled to have a great place for ceviche right in my neighborhood. Can't wait to go back for dinner! Highly recommend it, and if you do go, don't forget to make reservations, it gets really busy here.

photos.caption: Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Choclo corn cake. A must try
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Omelet with wild mushroom and scallops
Photo of Andina - London, United Kingdom. Yummy Yuca fries

AAYUnI5Z_swxyFMI-XU08w.text: I'm a Peruvian food lover and all I can say is that this is one of the best I ever had so far! Really good Piscos, a large range of ceviches (Classico and Andino are a must order ones)! Staff super friendly! We were seated by the bar just in front of the open kitchen and it was very pleasant to watch how they prepare the dishes! Busy busy on weekends, make sure you arrive not too late or make a reservation first! Wonderful dinner and I totally recommend to everyone!

Ao5tPRgJTwaI5fNG3fAX8g.text: Since I have eaten at Andina in London, I crave their food. It's so original, so different, so refined and not even that expensive for London. I wish I could live right next to that place... Absolutely terrific.

Wcv4uiPWacFrIXIG2CVoIQ.text: Beautiful food if you order right. Get a reservation!We went without reservations and had a good time because the staff was kind enough to offer us a reserved table till the reservation came in.
